column4: I need a user for samba. can i create a unix user without creating a home directory?
a user for samba? you mean to login to your linux server from another machine?
yeah
samba users are seperate from normal unix users
use smbpasswd -a username to add a samba user. i.e. you use that username and password to access the files you're sharing by samba
as root btw :P
yeah i have tried that but i get this error Failed to initialise SAM_ACCOUNT for user a. Does this user exist in the UNIX password database ?
you have to use the same name as a unix user that already exists - i suggest you use your normal username for samba as well
Then when i try to loggon i get this error message: 'session setup failed: NT_STATUS_LOGON_FAILURE'
i tried to loggon using smbclient //192.168.0.X/username
which computer are you trying to access using smbclient? your linux one?
yes
this is my config http://rafb.net/paste/results/9vnso246.html
so you have two linux boxes?
have you got a security= line in your smb.conf?
try adding security = user if it isn't there, or it's commented. then restart samba
i get the smae error mess session setup failed: NT_STATUS_LOGON_FAILURE
i'm not sure then. try googling for the error
sorry i couldn't help you more
thanks alot for youre help
it's ok
